meanings.sent1: The teacher was nixing the idea of a field trip due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to nix the proposal for a new project.
meanings.sent3: The cat was nixing the idea of taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were nixing any chance of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The judge's gavel came down, nixing any further arguments in the courtroom.

meanings.definition: To cancel or put an end to
meanings.sent1: The airline was nixing the flight due to mechanical issues.
meanings.sent2: She had to nix her plans for a picnic because of the rain.
meanings.sent3: The magician was nixing the rabbit trick after it went wrong too many times.
meanings.sent4: The final exam nixed any hopes of a relaxing weekend.
meanings.sent5: The broken printer nixed any chance of printing the important document on time.

meanings.sent1: He was nixing all requests for time off during the busy season.
meanings.sent2: The company had to nix the idea of a bonus due to budget constraints.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater was nixing all vegetables from his plate.
meanings.sent4: The locked door nixed their escape plan.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules nixed any possibility of a relaxed atmosphere.
